column4: I was attempting to upgrade the fglrx drivers on my laptop, and upon restart, 11.10 will no longer boot. I'm able to boot into Windows 7 on the same machine and access the grub config, but am not sure what I should start with to repair my installation. Any recommendations?
No, fresh install on its own partition.
how are you accessing the grub.config?
I have ext4 drivers for Windows installed, so I can read/write to that partition, though I've not changed anything yet.
so you have easybcd or grub in the mbr?
actually easybcd would not be in the mbr, cool grub.
I installed 11.10 from a live-usb second to ensure it would write the boot partition.
so what happens when you choose ubuntu from the grub menu?
Non-graphical boot process, eventually freezing after saying... some stuff about battery states, I think?
I'm not really solid in this area, but I would think if you get to a cli and remove the fglrx drivers you would be in, I don't thin it is a grub problem.
Any idea how to manually boot to a cli from grub? I removed all grub entries except the main "Boot 11.10" and "Boot Windows"
try the recovery option in the grub menu, you can get there probably
Recovery isn't in grub, that was removed
you might try hitting e at the menu and inserting nomodeset right before no spash the hitting crtl-x to a cli then removing there, or trying start-x to get to the desktop.
you can chroot from a live cd probably and remove it, I don't know how myself.
I'm assuming this will work at all as well.
Hey, it's more of a guess than I had :P
